intro: Marsdenia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are borne in terminal clusters. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
